data.title: Add Dune 2000 map Lynch Pass (2 player)
data.body:
![lynchpass](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/15757808/528a615c-28ff-11e6-8f71-b6e607712121.png)
A 2 player map that forces vehicles through the middle S chokepoint, in the centre of which sand worms are able to spawn. Infantry, however, can access the cliff tops in the centre, allowing them unique freedom to move through the map and strike the enemy base and spice expansion. Expansion is quite necessary too, as as the game progresses players will need to claim further fields and there are two large rock areas for expansion directly opposite each starting position.

data.title: Fix air resupply problem #5966
data.body:
Yet again i messed up my branch soo much that i needed to create a new one to be able to push... sorry about this. It seems I have a lot to learn about git.
So I think the pull request from https://github.com/bateramos/OpenRA/tree/upsteram/%235966 (upsteram/#5966) can be closed in favor of this one.

I made a video with the changes in this pull request.

data.title: TD: Missions screen is too small for mission names
data.body:
See screenshot:

![missions_screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4711816/15753570/00a3e968-28f4-11e6-93a8-273ee3ee2988.jpg)

I dunno if I should shorten the names or if the missions screen should receive a redesign. The names are as follows:
- Destroy the Mammoth Tank Facility
- Recapture The Ezekiel's Wheel (a)
- Recapture The Ezekiel's Wheel (b)

And probably some other missions that haven't been ported yet.

data.title: TD: Missing scientist unit
data.body:
There are a few missions with scientist units: Dr. Mobius and Dr. Wong Hu Chan. 
Compared to civilians they...
- Can't attack.
- Feature different animations.
- Have different voice samples.
- Display their full name in the tooltip.

**Following missions use those scientists:**
- GDI 8b (Dr. Mobius)
- GDI 12a (Dr. Mobius)
- GDI 12b (Dr. Mobius)
- Nod 10a (Dr. Wong Hu Chan)

Required for: #4988

data.title: Reduce gliding effect on smooth turns while moving
data.body: The worst offender is the turn around a single cell obstacle, because the turning actor will just shift straight from one cell corner to the other. Therefore, until we have a better turning logic, we disable smooth turning for these specific turns.

data.title: Add support for GIMP palette *.gpl files
data.body: https://github.com/PintaProject/Pinta/blob/7a6408db10534aff4ba5c14333b606b6324e82e7/Pinta.Core/Classes/Palette.cs#L183 can be used as a template to parse the file. It would add a file format to the engine that can be edited with free software across platforms.

data.title: [RA] Destroyable civilian buildings and fuel drums
data.body:
In the original Red Alert, you could target fuel drums and civilian buildings to attack.  This allowed the player to clear out areas for building on.  Riflemen and grenadiers could target everything and Tanya could C4 buildings.

Currently, this does not exist in the current version (20160508).

data.title: Moved projectiles to their own namespace and streamlined property names
data.body:
Even though they are (currently) technically effects, I think it's a bit un-intuitive to have them located along more regular effects.

Additionally, there were several inconsistencies between the sprite projectiles, which made switching between those projectiles a larger hassle than necessary.

I also found some descriptions to be a little confusing.

Finally, `LaserZap` and `TeslaZap` classes were not `public` yet.

The upgrade rules were only put together into the last commit to avoid rebase conflicts as much as possible, all yaml changes were performed by them, so they've been tested and seem to work fine.

data.title: Cleaned up upgrade rules
data.body: Considering there's been about 5 months of upgrade rules included in the latest release, I thought we might as well make another clear cut here. From my own experience, it's generally safer to upgrade 3rd-party mods at least every release anyway.

data.title: Added UpgradeOnTerrain
data.body: In the example the jumpjet infantry will be able to cross water without getting wet feed and jumpjetting over cliffs. This is inspired by https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/172, but using a more generic approach with actor upgrades. It works surprisingly well with this simple setup already.

data.title: [RA] Add the fake SD to France
data.body:
Closes  #11229

The first commit reorders all fake structures in the build menu to match the build order of their real counterparts. This is also true of the actual code order in the fakes file. I left numeric gaps for missing buildings (helipad, REF, barr) if for some reason in the future these need to be added.

The second commit simply adds the SD and its fake icon to the bits folder.

data.title: Added burning trees to the Red Alert mod
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11180. Also found a missing :cactus: which was not set up.

data.title: Only check for and render selection bars for actors on screen
data.body:
This avoids expensive `FogObscures` checks and saves drawing selections bars for actors that are offscreen anyway.

In a 6 player TS game with a bunch of AI, the large number of units meant 4.3% of total CPU time was spent checking if actors were obscured by fog when deciding to render selection bars or not. (Our visibility checks are quite expensive on non-flat maps).

By changing this to limit to the visible screen, we only have to check actors onscreen at any time which scales much better - it also means we avoid rendering bars for offscreen stuff as a bonus.

This reduces the checks to about 0.6% of total CPU.

data.title: New mod content installer
data.body:
The original content installer has been hacked together over the years, and had a whole bunch of limitations.  This PR completely rewrites it, bringing the following benefits:
- Now understands the difference between different content sources, making it easy to add new ones in the future (Origin / cncnet / GOG etc, as well as translated versions).
- Can now install disk-specific assets (FMVs, expansion music)
- Improved discovery for music installation
- Includes mod-specific description text, making it clear that our asset downloads come from the freeware TD/RA/TS releases
- Removes the modchooser dependency on game-specific package parsers (Installshield, Mix, etc)

There are currently two minor regressions which I would like to leave to followup PRs (the PR is big enough as it is, and these are separate to the main changes):
- We lose TFD support until somebody who has access to the disk can set up the new metadata for it
- The music installation prompt is not shown for players who have the hacked scores.mix from the original assets download.  A future PR will add metadata that tells the game to delete that file as a migration step

Closes #7412, Closes #11344, Closes #10556
Related to #9479, #5970, #8993, #4361, #9082

![screen shot 2016-05-29 at 19 55 37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15691759/8951f17e-2782-11e6-95b8-9f701769b62a.png)
![screen shot 2016-05-29 at 19 56 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15635515/c729959e-25d7-11e6-854f-779485d12792.png)
![screen shot 2016-05-29 at 19 56 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15635514/c71cc4b8-25d7-11e6-8cd4-3de7bdf7cff7.png)
![screen shot 2016-05-29 at 19 56 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15635516/c7354524-25d7-11e6-8f1c-5750dcb7f465.png)

data.title: Fix calling OnOwnerChange with wrong player in ProximityCapturable
data.body:
The actor's owner only gets changed in an end frame task queued by `Actor.ChangeOwner`. So during this frame end task, `self.Owner` still points to the old owner, whereas we want the new one, represented by `captor.Owner`.

This bug lead to the capture notification being played when _losing_ a building, but not when actually capturing it.

data.title: Fixed footprints of several RA and TD base structures
data.body:
There were several cases of base buildings in RA and TD with the top row of the footprint only consisting of `_` cells, namely

RA:
- Advanced Power Plant
- Fake Advanced Power Plant
- Tesla Coil
- Gap Generator
- Flak Cannon

TD:
- Weapons Factory
- Temple of Nod
- Hand of Nod
- Obelisk
- Advanced Guard Tower

In the case of defenses, this meant that the `CenterPosition` was located between the empty cell and the occupied cell, rather than centered on the occupied cell, which - while consistent with TD - was not consistent with original RA and made placing, attacking or C4'ing these structures look a bit dodgy.

To make placement, attacking, C4'ing and later on HitShape setup easier and more consistent, I've removed all those empty top rows and adjusted the art offsets instead.

_Note_: Due to the sheer amount of actors that would be affected, I've refrained from doing the same for trees and rocks (fortunately civilian structures are not affected), since they are indestructible in RA/TD and therefore wouldn't really benefit from similar fixes. And, of course, the diff and risk of regressions would go up considerably.

_Note2_: The upgrade rule did work on two maps, but then I ran into a bug in our map upgrading so I had to use a slightly modified version of my previous MapFormat upgrade rule to apply it to all maps.
Additionally, I ran into a zlib error when trying to upgrade the `.oramap` packages, so I could only fix the unzipped maps (though I'm not sure we ship any packaged maps which have these specific actors pre-placed.)

data.title: [RA] Add operation-goldmine.oramap
data.body:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/14344/ (updated)

An author I've never heard of before with a really nice 4 player map. Strategically it has a good number of expansions and ore mines, nice placement of tech buildings and a nice balance between choke-points and open areas.

Aesthetically I think its very tasteful. Props are used sparingly and fit the theater. The attention to detail is great and is up there with the likes of PizzaAtomica's maps.

It seems the bar has been raised with 1v1 maps but the competitive 4 player maps in the official pool is still seriously lacking. This map fits nicely with the current trend of maps and I would hope to see this in tourneys.

data.title: my menu buttons won't show up!
data.body: When I load up OpenRA it ggoes straight to tiberian dawn and the menu buttons that say things like Quit, Settings, Multiplayer, and etc don't show up! What should I do?

data.title: Fix shellmap UI disappearing prematurely when starting a mission or replay.
data.body: The mission and replay browsers now bind their UI cleanup to the `BeforeGameStart` event, matching what the Lobby UI has always done.  This fixes their UI being removed a tick too early.

data.title: Remove CanPowerDown from gates.
data.body: Gates are not powered, so it is bogus from a UI/UX perspective to allow them to be disabled using the powerdown cursor.

data.title: Add nod07c
data.body:
Add nod07c - "ORCA Theft"
http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/ORCA_Theft

data.title: Fixed various offsets in TS
data.body:
Successor to #11334.

No changes, I just messed up #11334 while cleaning my repo.

data.title: Fix helis being pushed off map pls.
data.body:
How do I img tags here?

https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-tsKlx_ssdOg/V0kzecGEjKI/AAAAAAAABuE/KbSa4SWIOXc5IlpkcNoAFKf3A8MBpoglACCo/s697/helis%2Boff%2Bmap%2Bbug.JPG

data.title: Add UI scaling.  It's very hard to see on high res displays
data.body:
The UI (especially the construction/minimap dialog) is extremely hard to see at high resolutions.  I use 2560x1440 and the text is about 2mm tall; Playing at 3840x2160 would be close to impossible.  UI is not currently impacted by pixel doubling.

I have attempted running the game in a lower resolution in all window modes, but there are some major rendering issues related to the positioning of things when forcing non-native resolutions in settings.yaml (at least on Linux), which of course is another issue entirely.  

The preferred solution anyway would be to allow scaling of the UI elements.

I searched around and couldn't find this posted anywhere, hopefully this isn't a dupe post.  Wonderful game, just very difficult to play.

data.title: Unhardcode the lobby options backend.
data.body:
This follows on from #11176 and #10857, taking us another step towards mod/map defined lobby options.

All of the options except for map difficulty and game speed are migrated to a new mod-level options order, and the traits are set up to use these.  Difficulty and game speed require nontrivial changes to integrate with the new system, so these will be done with their own followup PRs.  After those are complete we can implmement the dynamically generated options bin UI.

data.title: Allow VS2015 to format solution file
data.body:
Allowing VS to format this file as it likes means users of this IDE don't need to reset it each time VS decides to streamroll over it with arbitrary changes.

Updates version number to VS2015 Update 2. (See also #10669)

Sorts files in its preferred order (See also #9979, #9696)

data.title: Add Polygon HitShape
data.body:
As mentioned in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10349.

```
[15:23] <pchote> you want Exts.PolygonContains
[15:23] <pchote> for polygon hit testing
[15:23] <pchote> I think it would be better to have a polygon hit shape instead of footprint
[15:24] <pchote> because footprints might have holes in them
[15:24] <pchote> and handling that case makes the code at least 5 times more complicated
[15:24] <pchote> the other half of the hitshape is distance from polygon, which you get by taking the minimum distance from each line in the shape
[15:25] <pchote> which i'm pretty sure we have code for
[15:25] <pchote> just need to enumerate the edges
```

data.title: Add new lua functions and fix the air attacks in allies05a
data.body:
Following functions are added:

_AircraftProperties_
- void Land(Actor landOn)
- void Resupply()
- ~~Actor GetActorBelow()~~

_AmmoPoolProperties_
- int AmmoCount(string poolName = "primary")
- ~~bool HasFullAmmo(string poolName = "primary")~~
- ~~bool HasAmmo(string poolName = "primary")~~
- void Reload(string poolName = "primary", int amount = 1)
- int MaximumAmmoCount(string poolName = "primary") 

I also made the `Attack` lua method available for non-mobile actors.
As bonus: I fixed the air attacks in `allies05a` and this is the prerequisite for `allies04`.
